channel.title: /biz/ Active (no generals, context, ticker-first, exploding)

61857546

61857565
>>61857313
>There is zero counterargument.
I am sorry. But there is no answer to the CUSIP Conundrum. What else am I to believe other than the thesis that CH11 for BBBYQ would end in a transaction. We now have evidence that this transaction took place. You just don't like that I harp on it and won't let it go.
You are just a grumpy wumpy seethy weethy

61857577
>>61857546
>What do you guys think about DK-Butterfly's CUSIP matching the new BBBY warrants?
This is quite intriguing indeed! By my best calculations, it appears that BBBYQ shell has reverse merged with BBBY. This is the only way possible the warrants would use the wrong CUSIP.
This would be like filing your taxes and you suddenly misusing the wrong social security number when filling out the paperwork. The bankers that help underwrite these securities are not guessing and using the wrong CUSIP. When the investment bankers helped in creating these warrants for distribution, at that very moment the controlling interest of BBBY was BBBYQ. It's 100% proven fact. It's a fact because we can literally check the CUSIPs right here right now. We can also go into Bed Bath and Beyond stores right here and now. We also know what a Butterfly transaction is. It's exactly what happened in this CH11. There is still much more to come!

61857602
>>61857565
There is an answer, you just refuse to accept it because of your mental illness. Anyone who held BBBYQ at cancelation will never get anything for it, that was a 100% loss that is unrecoverable.
There are also some that know this, yet try to tie the old BBBYQ to the warrants in order to pump and dump them.

61857791

61857968
>>61857602
>There is an answer

1 - State the obvious. Reverse merger already happened. Towelkings win.
2 - State a logical explanation why the wrong CUSIP is being used on warrants in the context that we've been postulating for YEARS that this restructuring ends in a transaction. The evidence supports our thesis.
3 - Be a grumpy wumpy seethy weethy.
Those are your only options, and no, being a seethy does not solve the CUSIP Conundrum. If you can't solve the conundrum then that means we have our Cusip Confirmation.

61859785
>>61858023

61859951
>>61857805
>international order
jesus christ turn off the television. US economy (and western economy) is in tatters precisely because of the "international order" ie ZOG. They flood your country with cheap violent labor to suppress wages and sow division, they inflate away your wealth by constantly printing to pay the interest on government borrowing for GIBS for your replacements and zog wars.

How the fuck do you reach the conclusion that America needs an "international order" to function when it's downfall has correlated perfectly to its kowtowing to international interests. America is almost entirely self-sufficient and has plenty of skilled workers. It doesn't need an international order, it needs a financial sector that isn't destroying the country for its own benefit and it needs to get rid of the millions of useless eaters in your country. Get America back up to 70%+ White, fix your money printing problem, deal with the israel problem in your government, and the economy will take care of itself.

It's just nuts to me that people talk about the economy without mentioning the giant rotting elephant in the room which is the trillions that gets siphoned from productive workers to various kike interests. The K-shaped economy isn't an accident it's deliberate.

61859958
>>61857490
>DEI moneysinks getting destroyed
Sucks to suck. Go be a negro in Negrovia or something

61859986
>>61857490
Isn't it good for the US economy if everyone is losing their jobs to AI?

61860143
>>61858383
>go to jobcentre
>get offerd the a streetsweeper
>"I din't waste 6 years of my life getting a master's to sweep puke and shit of the sidewalk"
>"well if you don't want to work than you can't be unemployed, so no benefits for you"
>"Call me Broomy-Mcbroomster guvna"

61860535
>>61860143
I wish I got benefits, I've been unemployed in Poland for 7 years now and I've gotten a grand total of $0 in benefits

61860619
>>61859951
>Get America back up to 70%+ White, fix your money printing problem, deal with the israel problem in your government, and the economy will take care of itself.
anything else while we have the magic wand out sir?

61860705
>>61859951
>How the fuck do you reach the conclusion that America needs an "international order" to function when it's downfall has correlated perfectly to its kowtowing to international interests
What international interests? The US has been profiting off the international order since Breton Woods. Its rise as a superpower correlates to the dollar’s international dominance. It’s the opposite of what you’re describing.
>America is almost entirely self-sufficient
It is completely dependent on foreign pharmaceuticals and various input goods for manufacturing. It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
>the problem is international Jewry and this will be rectified when the us becomes an autarky
Why?

The rotting elephant in the room is a declining dollar, obscene debt, and an overinflated market + made up statistics. None of this gets better by fucking up international trade.

61860719
>>61857750

US being in a recession isn't about Trump.
Yes he's a fucking retarded boomer brained moron, but US has been doomed to hit this point sooner or later ever since they decided to crank the money printers on permanently after 2008 and doomed the entire West to be stuck in a slow death limbo.
Everyone has basically just been waiting for the big one for years now and we're getting closer and closer to it.

61860738
>>61859951
You have no idea how the dollar system works and it shows. What's happening to the United States right now is irreversible

61860813
>>61860719
Printing after 2008 happened because 2008 happened, which happened because republicans deregulated finance. You're right, it's not about Trump, it's about half the country being fucking retarded hicks

61860867
>>61860813
Republicans like Raegan deregulated finance, that’s true (though some of that was put into motion by Jimmy Carter). That said, it’s impossible to talk about 2008 without recognizing that Clinton is the one who repealed the Glass-Steagall act and let insurance banking merge with commercial banking. Pretty much every president for the 30 years leading up to 2008 did something to enable it or make it worse.

61860880
>>61860867
I forgot that Clinton was also the one that made derivatives immune to regulation. He really fucked up finance.

61860916
>>61857825
Holy shit this is the most retarded post I have ever read on /biz/, why are you on a finance board??

61860980
>>61860880
Clinton also forced banks to give mortgages to people with bad credit scores and low income

61861063
>>61857508

GDP was never meant to measure the health of the economy. Simon Kuznets advised against using it for that purpose.

61861445
>>61860705
>It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
There are actually fucking tons of sources, but none of them are developed because US companies exported the environmental cost of mining them to "dEvElOpInG" nations for cheaper labor/materials and most of the mines shut down because they couldn't compete. There are ludicrous amounts of these materials just sitting there in the US.

The US could be self-sufficient (example: fracking boom was because oil price had gotten to the point where domestic supply was economically viable again - in less than a decade the US had more oil than it could even use, because the oil was already in the ground, just not being extracted), but the profit motive won't allow self-sufficiency to persist if it's cheaper to import.

item.title: [TICKER | EXPLODING 84.0/hr] Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us? — 21 replies
item.content:encoded:
Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?

Open thread • Replies: 21 • Updated: 2026-02-16 18:15 UTC

OP

You guys in the EU make less than us on paychecks, but you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare and PTO while we have to pay for private insurance which chronically denies people's health situations.

Are people saying that starting a business in the EU is difficult because of the regulations? What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?

Early replies (first 3)

61860815
>>61860796
Depends enormously on which country are we talking about. Some are easy (Germany) some are very hard (Italy)

61860817
>>61860796
> you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare
yeah right
good luck getting that "universal healthcare" if you're not a boomer, waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure. It's either you go private (and pay out of your own pocket) or you die
> and PTO
oh wow, 20 wagie cagie free days a year. Totally worth the 60%+ taxes.

All taxation is theft. It's just that. Taxation doesn't pay for services. It's just the way they control the economy, and here in EU they fucking LOVE to control what you can and cannot do. They print the money, they don't need to tax you. They tax you to control you (and to humiliate you)

61860822
>>61860796
The healthcare thing is too much american leftie argument, it also has been very overcrowded by you guessed arabs and africans, unironically I was better treated when I broke my leg in brazil of all places then in france

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860823
>>61860815
How about the Czech Republic?

61860836
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure
we have them too except they're called "pre authorization" and we still get to pay for it all.

61860837
>>61860796
>What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?
You're shitting me right? As the other guy said it really varies based on the country, but in places like Italy you need 20 authorizations and 10 certifications (that you pay for) to open something like a bar or a carpentry shop, plus constant "controls" which are basically bribe requests at this point by officials of all kinds. Oh, and good luck filing your taxes. Here's how it goes
> be business owner
> tax filing time (yay)
> tax system is so incredibly fucking complex you have to hire people just to calculate how much you own
> because of course YOU need to tell the state how much the state wants from YOU
> slightest fuck up? You're on the hook for 240% of the original amount
> they have 5-7 years to come after you
> "oh hello here's a tax bill from 5 years ago cause you filed 3.51 euros less than you were supposed to, plus 1500 eur sanction, plus interest"
> oh btw you pay FIRST, and MAYBE when (after an average of 12 years in court at your expense) you are declared right, you get it back, no interest accrued, your legal expenses still on your back
> so most people just pay
> it's mafia with a hand of paint on top and the full force of the state behind it
EU is completely fucked. Stay away. We can just pray it somehow implodes from within. These bureaucrat jew lover good goyim will kill us all and replace us with shitskin and pajeets and they will feast on top of it all while the continent dies

61860842
>>61860837
>tax system is so incredibly fucking complex you have to hire people just to calculate how much you own
>> because of course YOU need to tell the state how much the state wants from YOU
>> slightest fuck up? You're on the hook for 240% of the original amount
>> they have 5-7 years to come after you
>> "oh hello here's a tax bill from 5 years ago cause you filed 3.51 euros less than you were supposed to, plus 1500 eur sanction, plus interest"
>> oh btw you pay FIRST, and MAYBE when (after an average of 12 years in court at your expense) you are declared right, you get it back, no interest accrued, your legal expenses still on your back
>> so most people just pay
>> it's mafia with a hand of paint on top and the full force of the state behind it
>EU is completely fucked. Stay away.
again this is more or less the same as the US

61860847
>>61860823
A bureaucracy nightmare.

61860850
>>61860842
everywhere is completely fucked, but you burgers have weapons and a strong constitution that backs you

yeah you're retarded pussies and you will never ever use them, we all know. I mean they're telling you know that you're ruled upon by a bunch of satanist jew pedophiles and there's no shooting in the streets, so there you have it. But at least you have the guns. If the Cheka comes knocking at your door demanding your harvest and your daughters, you can shoot back at the fuckers. Here in EU we're basically at the mercy of a state that hates us and wants us dead, and we have only our dicks to hold in our hands to defend ourselves from it

61860860
>>61860796
As far as I keep reading on economic subreddits, negligible, the US just has far more available credit and tax companies a bit less at start allowing them to grow, otherwise its basically the same, sounds legit just a complacency issue from europeans, most of the time they get more unemployment benefits than they would working and have legit no time limit for them so they just don't bother lol

61860967
in my country, the one thing one has to look out for is paying for your own social/healthinsurance, ie, if you have your own business, you need to pay taxes for your own health/socialinsurance, and the taxman wont ask you for the first 3y of that business.
After the 3y pass, you will then have to payup all the retrospective social insurance tax costs incurred, which fucks over a lot of retard or unfortunate first business owners

61861032
>>61860837
This is why we need a unified EU business regulation and undermind the corrupt sovereignist that want to keep individual burocratic fuckery.

61861057
>>61860815
>Some are easy (Germany)
> some are very hard (Italy)
let me guess italian never tried germany?
Germany is known to be a bureucracy hellhole with people fleeing to other countries from it.

>>61861032
>unified will fix it
France&germany have been dictating eu lawmaking. You will eat shit as you already do. You have eu wide higher taxes because germany didnt want to compete and made mandatory higher minimum vat a thing.

Not to mention that countries that joined got their industries destroyed by unified regulation and had to import from germany/france what they used to produce themself

61861071
It's the one thing the USA gets right. I personally made a "business" (that never made any profit) in the span of an afternoon. Cost maybe $200 to get my identification numbers for the llc

61861091
>>61861032
yeah let's give the EU bureaucrats more power that will fix it

61861111
>>61860796
>Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?
Depends on the business. If you want to do something shady the US is the place to go. The US has barely any standards and barely any regulations.

61861113
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure
What are you talking about? I live currently in the EU and have never had to wait for medical care.

61861119
Us is easier.
I have created 2 corpos and 1 llc for different purposes within the past 8 years. You can do it all online for a few bucks, other regulations depend on specific industry but overall it's pretty easy

61861128
>>61860860
higher taxation alone puts euros at a disadvantage. Its fine if you do a local job since you compete with locals but anything online / shipped its bad since they have to be more efficient than rest of world to reach same profit margin.

As for amount of bureaucracy its fucking complex and depends on what country and what profession. There is even stupid shit like if you run a repair shop and repair inside your building it counts different than if you decide to drive to your customer and repair locally. In the later case they classify you as a handyman worker and will fine you if you didn't register with the craftsman ministry. Also if you do something you didn't register for you will also be fined but you can register as " i will do anything" more broadly and dodge it. The amount of bullshit can easily fill a book.

61861429
>>61860796
Depends on what your goals are, the type of business, your personal goals and the markets you wish to enter. In general it's more of an investment in the long run but if you plan to offer your services or products in the EU anyway it makes sense to start your business here and already be compliant

61861441
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure.
Yeah, I remember waiting decades for my appendicitis, it rupturing and me dying because of it. Thankfully they could keep me alive for months despite the extreme difficulties this poses.

>>61861032
We need more unified European regulation. Sadly the EU is not an economic alliance anymore.
